lines.text: It's as though we're all seeds of evil.
Winter's coming in and the wolves coming with it.
Oona. Of course. Once I showed her mercy. I should have killed her.... Burke. I don't care how you do it - bring Oona to me.

[to Maggie]
We can make you die a minute every day for a year.

[to the crowd partying at his castle, when they have been frightened by a wolf's howl]
That mad dog that you all thought the product of sorcery is DEAD.
Now drink, dance, and be merry.
I sent nightmare cats to plague the Whitmans.
Look, Father, an open tomb. Let's see what's inside.
What, and whom.
[panicking because everyone is dying]
Light. Light. Sean. Burke. I want this house to shine as bright as noon.
[when asked what is written on the gravestone]
It says, "Born by fire, dies by fire." What it means, don't ask me. It don't even rhyme.

[proudly, to his sons]
You may have heard that they think of me as some kind of monster in the village.
Who'd have use for a dead man's hand, Mister Mickey, sir?
Witches, my boy. There's evil around.
When I'm flying, I can shoot down any Christian who sees me and does not cross himself.
H is for heretic.
How much are we paying the weepers?
Five groats a head, my lord.
See that they weep til dawn.

[to Sean Whitman]
Don't you know this house is cursed? You are cursed, and Edward's cursed, and everybody's cursed.
